channel.title: Massachusetts Institute of Technology Promises 500 – 1000GHz Processors
channel.description:
Massachusetts Institute of Technology Promises 500 – 1000GHz Processors. New research findings at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) could lead to microchips that operate at speeds of up to 1000GHz (1THz) than is possible with today's standard silicon chips, leading to cell phones and other communications systems that can transmit data much faster.
Complete article: [url=http://www.xbitlabs.com/news/other/display/20090326132031_Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology_Promises_500__1000GHz_Processors.html]http://www.xbitlabs.com/news/other/display/20090326132031_Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology_Promises_500__1000GHz_Processors.html[/url] I just came. I know this isn't finished, and it won't be finished within a few years, but still. 1Thz processors!

item.title: Massachusetts Institute of Technology Promises 500 – 1000GHz Processors
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

la­wl:

wouldnt they get raped by intel etc if they release their own product because all current cpu makers would go out of business

They’ve already been contacted by chip manufacturers. I doubt a University can mass produce anything.

xEnt:

many years away until mainstream.

While the work is still at the laboratory stage, Mr. Palacios says, because it is mostly based on relatively standard chip processing technology he thinks developing it to a stage that could become a commercial product "may take a year of work, maximum two.

I guess IBM/others will use it in their supercomputers first, until it’s more affordable.

Read full topic
item.source: Massachusetts Institute of Technology Promises 500 – 1000GHz Processors

item.title: Massachusetts Institute of Technology Promises 500 – 1000GHz Processors
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:269703”]At lanch it will be 200 times faster than normal the best of silicon CPU’s therefore it will be 200 times more expensive as that Quad Core 3.2Ghz i7.
That comes out as £200000 ($286000).[/quote]
Yes and put an Apple logo on it and you can add £100000 to the price.

Just joking, that logic does not work, this is a new technology that will give much better Processors to much lower prices.

Read full topic
